segments.text: Steven , I am ready for breakfast .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: OK . But where is my favorite coffee ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It's in that pan there . Your boy Dean broke the silex yesterday , so I have to boil it in the pan .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It tastes like crankcase oil , but delicious .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's good . You can make breakfast yourself if you don't like it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I warmed a couple of snails , and your eggs are in the frying pan .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , my God . It's nearly eight , I have no time to have breakfast now . My watch says seven fifty .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Don't worry . It's only ten to seven . You must have forgotten to set your watch back .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , it was . The clock on the wall says eight to seven .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah . Keep on eating your breakfast . You can catch the early bus .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Gee . I could have slept another hour .
segments.speaker: S2
